p: Using data available from the NICD for Johannesburg, the enrollment of the pregnant women coincided with the RSV epidemics in 2011 and 2012 ( Figure 1A). The peak in number of respiratory visits among the women, including the postpartum period, occurred mainly during the influenza season ( Figure 1B). Furthermore, 77.5% of births in 2011 and 97.8% in 2012 occurred during the RSV season. Details on the total number of illness visits, as well as visits stratified by the RSV season and availability of samples for RSV testing, are reported in Supplementary Table 1.
